application_data.application_requirements:
### Undergraduate Admission Requirements:

To be considered for undergraduate admission to Minnesota State University, Mankato, applicants must be graduates of an accredited high school or hold a GED certificate. The university has a test-optional policy, meaning ACT or SAT scores are not required for admission but will be considered if submitted.

Automatic Admission:
An applicant will be automatically admitted if they meet any one of the following criteria:
*   A cumulative high school GPA of 3.0 or higher.
*   A rank in the top 50% of their high school graduating class.
*   An ACT composite score of 21 or higher combined with a minimum cumulative high school GPA of 2.7.

Application Process:
*   Submit the online application and a non-refundable $20 application fee.
*   Request that an official high school transcript be sent to the Office of Admissions.
*   If you have earned college credits during or after high school, you must also submit official transcripts from those institutions.

For applicants who graduated from high school three or more years ago and have no subsequent formal schooling, admission is granted upon application and proof of high school graduation or satisfactory GED scores.

Evidence:
*   https://www.mnsu.edu/future-students/admissions/undergraduate/requirements
*   https://www.mnsu.edu/future-students/admissions/undergraduate/apply/process-calendar
*   https://www.mnsu.edu/future-students/admissions/applying-for-admission/

### Graduate Admission Requirements:

Admission requirements for graduate programs at Minnesota State University, Mankato vary by specific program. Prospective students should consult the webpage for their intended degree program for detailed information.

General Admission Standards:
*   Applicants must typically have a GPA of 3.0 or better in their overall undergraduate studies. Provisional admission may be offered to applicants with a lower GPA, contingent on meeting specific performance requirements.
*   GRE scores are not required for general admission but may be recommended or required for specific programs.

Application Process:
*   Complete the graduate application online.
*   Pay the non-refundable $40 application processing fee.
*   Upload unofficial transcripts from each previously attended institution as part of the application. Official transcripts will be required upon admission.
*   International applicants must submit a credential evaluation from a NACES member.

Application Deadlines (Domestic Students):
*   Spring Admission: December 1st
*   Summer Admission: April 30th
*   Fall Admission: August 1st

Evidence:
*   https://www.mnsu.edu/future-students/admissions/graduate
*   https://www.mnsu.edu/academics/graduate-studies/admissions-and-aid/application-process-and-calendar/
*   https://www.mnsu.edu/academics/communication-studies/graduate-program/application-process/
*   https://www.mnsu.edu/future-students/admissions/international/graduate/requirements

application_data.test_policy:
For undergraduate programs, Minnesota State University, Mankato is test-optional. For graduate programs, the submission of official test scores, such as the GRE or GMAT, may be required depending on the specific degree program.

Evidence:

*   Undergraduate Test Policy: The official university website states, "Minnesota State Mankato is test-optional for admissions." This information is available on the Undergraduate Student Admissions Requirements page (https://mnsu.edu/future-students/admissions/undergraduate/requirements/) and the Applying for Admission page (https://www.mnsu.edu/admissions-and-aid/apply/admission-requirements/freshman/).
*   Graduate Test Policy: The University Admissions page notes for graduate programs, "Some degree programs require the submission of additional application materials...Additionally, some programs require the submission of official scores for the General Test of the Graduate Record Examination (GRE) or the Graduate Management Admission Test (GMAT)." This information can be found at (https://www.mnsu.edu/academics/academic-catalog/admissions-and-registration/university-admissions/).
application_data.courses_and_grades:
### Admission Requirements for Minnesota State University, Mankato

To be considered for admission to Minnesota State University, Mankato, prospective undergraduate students who are graduates of accredited high schools or have a GED certificate must meet specific academic standards. The university considers high school coursework, grades, class rank, and college entrance examination scores. Notably, Minnesota State Mankato is test-optional, meaning ACT or SAT scores are not required for admission decisions.

Automatic Admission Criteria:

An applicant will be automatically admitted if they meet any one of the following qualifications:
*   A cumulative high school GPA of 3.0 or higher.
*   A class rank in the top 50% of their high school graduating class.
*   An ACT composite score of 21 or higher combined with a minimum cumulative high school GPA of 2.7.

High School Course Preparation Standards:

Applicants' high school transcripts are evaluated based on the completion of the following college preparatory courses:

*   English: 4 years
*   Mathematics: 3 years, including intermediate algebra and geometry.
*   Science: 3 years, with at least one year in a biological science and one year in a physical science. All science courses must include laboratory work.
*   Social Studies: 3 years, including one year of U.S. history and one year of geography.
*   World Language: 2 years of the same language.
*   Arts/Humanities: 1 year of fine arts or humanities, which can include music, art, or theater.

For a comprehensive overview of the admission requirements, please refer to the [Undergraduate Student Admissions Requirements page](https://www.mnsu.edu/future-students/admissions/undergraduate/requirements/) on the official university website.
application_data.recommendations:
### Recommendation Requirements Vary by Program at Minnesota State University, Mankato

Undergraduate Programs:

There is no explicit university-wide requirement for letters of recommendation for undergraduate admission to Minnesota State University, Mankato. The university's admission requirements focus on high school coursework, GPA, and class rank. While some external sources suggest that recommendations may be considered if submitted, they are not a mandatory part of the application for general admission.

Graduate Programs:

For graduate programs, the requirement for letters of recommendation is determined by each individual program. There is no single university-wide policy on the number of recommendations needed. Prospective graduate students should consult the specific admission requirements for the program they are interested in.

For example, the Master of Science in Elementary Teaching program requires two letters of recommendation. The graduate program in Geography requires applicants to submit three letters of recommendation from individuals familiar with their undergraduate academic performance. The university's general graduate admissions information states that "Letters of recommendation, personal goals statements, and writing samples may be required," and directs applicants to individual program websites for specific requirements.
application_data.personal_essay:
Required.

Evidence: For undergraduate applicants who do not meet the automatic admission requirements, a personal statement is required as part of the Comprehensive Application Review. This is explicitly stated on the Minnesota State University, Mankato website's "Undergraduate Student Admissions Requirements" page.
application_data.writing_sample:
Not Required.

Evidence:

For undergraduate admissions, Minnesota State University, Mankato does not explicitly state a writing sample or essay is a general application requirement. The university's admission requirements for freshmen focus on high school coursework, GPA, and class rank.

For graduate admissions, a writing sample is not universally required for all programs. The university's graduate admissions website includes a page with "Writing Sample Instructions" which states, "Submit a maximum of two writing samples (publications, conference presentations, or agency/government reports), if applicable." The phrase "if applicable" indicates that the requirement for a writing sample is determined by the specific graduate program to which a student is applying. Applicants should verify the requirements for their individual program of interest.

URL:
The evidence for the conditional requirement of a writing sample for graduate studies can be found on the official Minnesota State University, Mankato website: [https://mnsu.edu/graduate-studies/admissions-and-applications/apply-now/writing-sample-instructions/](https://mnsu.edu/graduate-studies/admissions-and-applications/apply-now/writing-sample-instructions/)
application_data.additional_information:
While there are no university-wide "additional information requirements" for general admission to Minnesota State University, Mankato, several specific programs and situations do necessitate further documentation beyond the standard application.

Program-Specific Requirements:

Certain undergraduate and graduate programs at Minnesota State University, Mankato have additional application components. These are most common in health-related fields and other specialized areas. For instance:

*   Dental Hygiene: Applicants to the Dental Hygiene program may be required to submit observation hours in a dental setting, letters of recommendation, and a personal essay detailing their interest in the field.
*   Nursing: The School of Nursing often requires a separate application, a personal statement, and sometimes an interview. Specific prerequisite coursework with minimum grade requirements is also a key component.
*   Aviation: The Aviation program typically has additional requirements such as a flight physical (FAA Medical Certificate) and potentially an interview or essay related to the applicant's aviation goals.

Prospective students are advised to consult the specific departmental or program pages on the official university website (mnsu.edu) for detailed and up-to-date information on these additional requirements.

Conditional Admission:

In some cases, Minnesota State University, Mankato may offer "conditional admission" to applicants who do not meet all of the standard admission criteria. This is often contingent upon the student fulfilling specific requirements, which could include:

*   Submitting final high school or college transcripts.
*   Achieving a certain GPA in their final semester of high school or previous college coursework.
*   Completing specific prerequisite courses.
*   For international students, providing proof of English proficiency through standardized test scores (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS).

The specific conditions of admission are communicated to the applicant directly by the university's admissions office. Information regarding conditional admission can typically be found within the general admission requirements sections of the university's website.
application_data.additional_deadlines:
### Additional Deadlines at Minnesota State University, Mankato

Beyond standard application deadlines, Minnesota State University, Mankato has several important dates for scholarships, financial aid, and other financial matters.

Scholarship Deadlines:

*   University-wide Scholarships: The application period for university-wide scholarships opens on February 1 and closes on February 28th or 29th. Following the application period, the scholarship committee review process begins on March 1, and the student acceptance deadline is April 30.
*   Transfer Student Scholarships: For students transferring to the university in the fall, the scholarship application period opens on May 1, 2025, with a deadline of June 1, 2025.

Financial Aid Deadlines:

*   FAFSA Submission: To be considered for the Minnesota State Grant, the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) for the 2025-2026 academic year must be submitted by July 31, 2025. The FAFSA application becomes available starting December 1, 2024.
*   Financial Aid Disbursement: For the fall 2025 semester, the processing of financial aid funds begins on August 22, 2025, with the first disbursement scheduled for September 5, 2025. For the spring 2026 semester, financial aid funds will begin to be processed and posted to student accounts, with the first disbursement of any excess aid scheduled for January 23, 2026.

Other Financial Deadlines:

*   Payment Plans: The university offers several payment plan options through Nelnet/FACTS, each with its own enrollment deadline. For the fall 2025 semester, deadlines for various installment plans fall on June 27, July 25, and August 22, 2025. For the spring 2026 semester, deadlines for different payment plan options are in December, January, and February.
*   Bookstore Charges: Eligible students can charge textbooks and supplies from the Maverick Shop Bookstore to their student accounts during specific periods. For the fall 2025 semester, this period is from July 30 to August 28. For the spring 2026 semester, the period is from December 17, 2025, to January 15, 2026.
*   International Student Health Insurance: The deadline to pay for the 2025-2026 international student health insurance is July 25, 2025.

The university's admissions pages and frequently asked questions sections do not address this specific query. While many universities have clear policies on this matter, Minnesota State University, Mankato does not provide this information on its website. Therefore, based on the available information, it is not possible to definitively answer whether a student can apply to multiple programs at the institution.

boolean_fields_data.is_english_not_required:
False.

Evidence:

The official website for Minnesota State University, Mankato explicitly states that international students must demonstrate English proficiency. The requirements are detailed on several pages, including those for:

*   International Master's or Doctoral Student Admission: This page states that "International students must demonstrate English proficiency with TOEFL or IELTS Academic results," and provides minimum required scores.
*   International First-Year Student Admission: This page lists "Meet one of the minimum standards for English Proficiency" as a requirement for admission.
*   Master of Science in Electrical Engineering Admission: This page specifies "English proficiency for international applicants: a minimum 80 on the TOEFL iBT or 6.5 on the IELTS or a Dulingo Score of 105 is required."
*   College of Business Admission for International Students: This page indicates that "English proficiency scores (TOEFL/IELTS)" are required for students who do not use English as their first language.
*   International Transfer Students: Separate pages for transfer students with and without U.S. credits both list meeting English proficiency requirements as mandatory.
*   Geography M.S. Admission: This page states that "International applicants must submit a TOEFL score of at least 75... or an IELTS score of at least 6.0".
boolean_fields_data.is_english_optional:
False.

Evidence:

The official website for Minnesota State University, Mankato (mnsu.edu) explicitly states that international students are required to provide proof of English proficiency for admission.

For first-year international students, the university's admission requirements page specifies that applicants must "Meet one of the minimum standards for English Proficiency". Similarly, the admission requirements for international master's or doctoral students state that "International students must demonstrate English proficiency with TOEFL or IELTS Academic results," and provides minimum score requirements.

The university does outline certain exceptions to this requirement. For instance, applicants from countries where English is the sole official language of instruction may not need to submit TOEFL scores. Additionally, transfer students from a U.S. college or university can meet the requirement by completing English Composition courses with a satisfactory grade. However, these are specific exemptions and do not make the English proficiency test optional for all international applicants. The general requirement is to provide proof of English proficiency through a standardized test.
boolean_fields_data.is_gmat_or_gre_required:
Null
I was unable to find a university-wide policy on the Minnesota State University, Mankato website (mnsu.edu) that explicitly states whether the GMAT or GRE is required for all graduate programs. Admission requirements for standardized tests are typically determined by individual graduate programs. Therefore, it is not possible to return a single 'True' or 'False' answer for the entire university.
boolean_fields_data.is_gre_required:
False
Evidence: The requirement for a GRE score at Minnesota State University, Mankato is determined by the specific graduate program, it is not a university-wide requirement for all programs for international students. Some programs explicitly state that the GRE is not required, while others list it as a mandatory part of the application.

For instance, the Master of Science in Electrical Engineering program requires a GRE score for applicants who did not graduate from Minnesota State University, Mankato. On the other hand, the graduate program in Communication Studies does not require GRE scores for admission.

The university's general information for international master's and doctoral students states that the GRE "may be required for some programs" and advises applicants to "check the Graduate Degree Pages to find out if your program recommends submitting GRE scores". This indicates that there is no single policy that applies to all programs.
boolean_fields_data.is_ielts_required:
True

*   URL: https://www.mnsu.edu/future-students/international/undergraduate/international-first-year/

*   URL: https://www.mnsu.edu/future-students/international/undergraduate/international-transfer-students/transfer-without-us-credits/

boolean_fields_data.is_pte_required:
True
Evidence:

The official Minnesota State University, Mankato website lists the Pearson Test of English (PTE) as an acceptable method for demonstrating English proficiency for international students.

For international first-year and transfer students without U.S. credits, a minimum PTE score of 47 is required. This information is explicitly stated on the following pages:

*   International First-Year Student Admission Requirements: On this page, under the "English Language Proficiency Scores" section, the "Pearson Test of English (PTE)" is listed with a required score of "47 or better".
*   International Transfer Students without U.S. Credits: This page also includes a table under "English Language Proficiency Scores" which indicates a "Pearson Test of English (PTE)" score of "47 or better" is accepted.
